>
> I actually impl=
emented HyperNeat in Java about a year ago. (I had some trouble understandi=
ng what to do with ANJI and JNEAT too.)
> 
> It was designed to be able to =
modify the number of hidden layers. It was my first Java project and it was=
 unnecessarily complicated. However, a large chunk of the code was ported f=
rom the original C++ HyperNeat. I'm sure it's reusable with a bit tuning (e=
.g. not mutating number of layers and their connection patterns.)

ou want it, I will email you the code.
